dataset.title: Snail SDM Review Supplementary File Ecological Metadata

abstract.para: This is a data package containing two files related to the Galle et al. review on snail SDM best practice adherence. Supplementary file 1 contains the extracted metadata from the included studies, while supplementary file 3 contains the best practice adherence of the included studies, as scored by Galle et al. according to the guidelines presented in Araujo et al., 2019.

intellectualRights.para: This information is released under the Creative Commons license - Attribution - CC BY (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). The consumer of these data ("Data User" herein) is required to cite it appropriately in any publication that results from its use. The Data User should realize that these data may be actively used by others for ongoing research and that coordination may be necessary to prevent duplicate publication. The Data User is urged to contact the authors of these data if any questions about methodology or results occur. Where appropriate, the Data User is encouraged to consider collaboration or co-authorship with the authors. The Data User should realize that misinterpretation of data may occur if used out of context of the original study. While substantial efforts are made to ensure the accuracy of data and associated documentation, complete accuracy of data sets cannot be guaranteed. All data are made available "as is." The Data User should be aware, however, that data are updated periodically and it is the responsibility of the Data User to check for new versions of the data. The data authors and the repository where these data were obtained shall not be liable for damages resulting from any use or misinterpretation of the data. Thank you.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Studies reviewed herein span a global coverage.

description.para: Studies screened to make the datasets herein were collected through a systematic literature review to identify studies that applied SDM methodologies to snail intermediate hosts. For all studies metadata was extracted regarding study focus, species modeled, SDM methodologies applied, and adherence to Open Access and best modeling practices.

project.title: Synthesis and analysis of species distribution models applied to snail intermediate hosts.

dataTable.entityDescription: Data table from supplementary file 1, containing extracted metadata from studies applying SDMs to snail intermediate hosts.

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is the entry number assigned to the study from the initial screening process.
This is the entry designating the authors of the published study.
This is the entry designating the title of the study.
This is the entry designating the journal the study was published in.
This is the entry designating the year the study was published in.
This is the entry designating whether the studies model species that transmit schistosomiasis.

codeDefinition.definition: Indicates that some, but not all, of the species modeled in this study transmit schistosomiasis.
Indicates that none of the species modeled in this study transmit schistosomiasis.
Indicates that all of the species modeled in this study transmit schistosomiasis.

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is the entry designating the species name used in the study.

This is the entry designating the accepted versions of the species names used in the published studies according to the World Registry of Marines Species database, with the WoRMS AphiaID in parentheses after the accepted species name.
This is the entry designating the species of trematode(s) transmitted by the snail species in a given study.
This is the entry designating the geographic scale the study was conducted at.

codeDefinition.definition: This indicates the study had a global scale.
This indicates the study had a national scale (i.e. across the entirety of one country).
This indicates the study had a regional scale (i.e. across multiple countries).
This indicates the study had a sub-national scale (i.e. across only a portion of a country).

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is the entry designating what continent studies were focused on
This is the entry designating what countries the study focused on.
This is the entry designating what modeling approach the studies employed.

codeDefinition.definition: Mixed and ensemble modeling approaches were used.
Single and ensemble modeling approaches were used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is the entry designating what model algorithms were used.
This is the entry designating whether the studies use species occurrence or abundance in the response variable.
This is the entry designating what the source for the response variable was.
This is the entry designating what category of predictor variables were used.
This is the entry designating what resolutions were used in the predictor variable dataset.
This is the entry designating the source of the predictor variables.
This is the entry designating how studies assessed collinearity among predictor variables.

codeDefinition.definition: Pearson's correlation and principle component analysis

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is the entry designating how the testing dataset was created.

codeDefinition.definition: No testing dataset, or method not provided

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is the entry designating how studies evaluated model performance.
This is the entry designating study purpose, as defined by Araujo et al., 2019.
This is the entry designating whether the study references a global taxonomy for species names.
This is the entry designating what global taxonomy is referenced.
This is the entry designating whether the studies provide open access to their response variable dataset.

codeDefinition.definition: No open access to response dataset.

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is the entry designating whether studies provide open access to their predictor dataset.

codeDefinition.definition: No open access to predictor dataset.

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is the entry designating whether studies provide open access to their code used for statistical analysis.

dataTable.entityDescription: This is the data table corresponding to scores of study best practice adherence, as outline in Araujo et al., 2019.

attribute.attributeDefinition: This is the entry related to best practice adherence for occurrence/abundance sampling.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for species identification.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for spatial accuracy of response variable.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for environmental extent of the study.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for geographic extent of the study.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for choice of predictor variables.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for spatial and temporal resolution.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for predictor uncertainty.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for model complexity.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for bias and noise.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for predictor collinearity.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for model and parameter uncertainty.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for model assumptions.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for model outputs.
This is the entry related to best practice adherence for model performance.
This is the entry designating the year the study was published in.

otherEntity.entityDescription: R code used to generate analyses regarding area in the line for best practice adherence.
R code used to generate figures 1 and 2 in the Galle et al. review of SDMs applied to snail intermediate hosts.
R code to do statistical analysis relating to temporal trends in bets practice adherence.
